channel.title: Unseen Ideas (Killing)
channel.description:
What if we get rid of assassin at start up of unseen games and the killer converted classes become other killing classes.
Enforcer
NA1- Ambush. Attack someone visiting your target. Or attack your target if nobody visits your target NA2- Protection. Guard a unseen member from any investigation, occupation, target changing. (2 uses)
Poacher
NA1- Angry Wolf. Kill 2 people visiting your target. (Unusable till N4 or 10 people left in the game, has also got 2 uses) NA2- Getting Dirty. Attack your target it has 1/2 a chance to Bypass immunity
If No converted roles are kill capable. They will become an assassin with royal blood (If royal) You also can not also have a second kill capable unseen role. So if you convert another knight. They will become a enforcer with support abilities or poacher with offensive abilities

item.title: Unseen Ideas (Killing)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I made a faction that uses tactical kills.

Read full topic

item.title: Unseen Ideas (Killing)
item.dc:creator: RawkHawk
item.description:
That’s a super interesting idea that I think could be used to buff the unseen.

Not sure how feasible this is, but what if each member had a day ability to turn all their abilities into the assassin’s abilities? However, only one member could use this per day.

It’d definitely be insanely stupid to code.

The other idea is just tacking on a “kill” move to every unseen member, but only allow a single member of unseen to attack per night. With the exception of Sellsword’s other kill ability.

I’m not a coder, so can’t say how easy or hard this it, but it seems interesting, and would give the unseen much more flexibility.

Read full topic

item.title: Unseen Ideas (Killing)
item.dc:creator: orangeandblack5
item.description:
That’s not what “Mafia Tactical” is though

It’s a system whereby any member of the uninformed minority may perform the factional kill if they wish, as opposed to having one role (Assassin/Mafioso/etc.) which always kills.

Read full topic
